p: Table 3 shows that proportion of having different levels of anxiety (χ 2 = 4.340, p = .227, effect size = .064) and mental wellbeing (χ 2 = 3.874, p = .144, effect size = .060) of people from Hubei and other provinces nearly equal. However, there existed significant differences in depression (χ 2 = 11.908, p = .008, effect size = .105) and alcohol abuse (χ 2 = 30.772, p < .001, effect size = .169) between respondents from Hubei and other provinces. Although, proportions for mild and moderate depression were equal for both Hubei and other provinces, but, proportion of severe depression were more than twice for people from Hubei province than other provinces. Proportions of both harmful and hazardous users and alcohol dependent users were much higher for people from Hubei than other provinces.
